newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Pertamina steps up safety at oil refineries.
newsitem.headline: Pertamina steps up safety at oil refineries.

text.p: Indonesia's state oil company Pertamina said on Wednesday it had taken additional safety measures at its refineries after one of them was hit by a fire.
Pertamina junior processing director Samto Utomo said a fire, sparked by lightning, hit a crude oil storage tank at the 300,000-barrel per day capacity Cilacap refinery on Monday.
He said the fire caused little damage and that the storage tank could still be used.
"We will be installing more anti-lightning equipment at Cilacap refinery," Utomo told reporters. "Pertamina also has increased regular equipment checking all refineries."
Pertamina currently has eight refineries with a total capacity of 989,500 barrels per day.
Utomo said Monday's fire at the Cilacap refinery was extinguished in about 20 minutes and did not disrupt crude oil supply to the plant.
